name: Baby Jane - Hunt By the River (Hex Original Demo)

attributes.trait_type: Hunt By the River (Hex Original Demo)

metadata.description: This is the original demo version of a song called "Hunt By the River" which ultimately became Baby Jane's single, "Hex". Jane and her producer, John Flynn, started this as their first experimental "witch-punk" style song. During the process of making this track, Jane decided to rewrite a new song over this instrumental with the same female-empowering lyrical sensibilities. "Hex" was written and the beat was reworked to fit the new top-line, but "Hunt By the River" now remains as a demo version until further progress is made on this track! (Still, it is very special to the artist for it's confessional nature and poetic lyricism exploring important topics such as power dynamics and tw: s/a.)

lyrics.text:
I'm a captive, don't tap on the glass
I ain't asking for it wearing a dress
Just a small fish, and the animals
hunt by the river, hunt by the river

Shouts off the dock, but it's too late
you know I'm inebriated
No defenses, will is wasted 
All the morals are misplaced

I'm a captive, don't tap on the glass
I ain't asking for it wearing a dress
Just a small fish, and the animals
hunt by the river, hunt by the river

Steps on the concrete stalk your prey
I try not to catch your gaze
Hand in pocket, eyes evasive
Hoping I won't test my strength

I'm a captive, don't tap on the glass
I ain't asking for it wearing a dress
Just a small fish, and the animals
hunt by the river, hunt by the river

There's a message in my pain
No one would treat you this way
Count the stars, dissociate
Here comes the rain, here comes the rain

metadata.name: Hunt By the River (Hex Original Demo) - Golden Egg
metadata.title: Hunt By the River (Hex Original Demo)
